intro: Rosa × nitidula var. scabrata, commonly known as the rough-stemmed rose, is a hybrid rose species characterized by its rugged, thorny stems and dense foliage. It typically produces clusters of small, fragrant pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its leaves are dark green and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature in garden settings.
